metadata.title: CVE-2019-9444 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description: In the Android kernel in sync debug fs driver there is a kernel pointerleak due to the usage of printf with %p. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with system execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
